x10.matrix.dist.summa

Class SummaDense

  • x10.matrix.dist.summa.SummaDense

  • public class SummaDense
    This is SUMMA implementation in X10 for distributed dense matrix.

    In addition to the dimension requirement for matrix multiplication, to use SUMMA, all input and output matrices must be decomposed in the same way, which satisfies the matrix multiplication dimension requirement for blocks in the same position of two input matrices and output matrix.

    To achieve better performance, panel size needs to be optimized, which could be varied due to different matrices dimensions, network bandwidth, and BLAS library performance.

      • mult

        public static void mult(x10.lang.Int ps,
        x10.lang.Double beta,
        DistDenseMatrix A,
        DistDenseMatrix B,
        DistDenseMatrix C)
        SUMMA distributed dense matrix multiplication: C = A * B + beta * C.

        Two additional distributed dense matrices are created. These two matrices are panel size matrix used in row and column blocks broadcast and performing matrix multiplication.

        Parameters:
        ps - panel size
        beta - scaling factor for output matrix
        A - first input distributed dense matrix in multiplication
        B - second input distributed dense matrix in multiplication
        C - the input/result distributed dense matrix
        See Also:
        parallelMult(wk1, wk2)

      • multTrans

        public static void multTrans(x10.lang.Int ps,
             x10.lang.Double beta,
             DistDenseMatrix A,
             DistDenseMatrix B,
             DistDenseMatrix C)
        SUMMA distributed dense matrix multiplication: C = A * BT + beta C
        Parameters:
        ps - panel size
        beta - scaling factor for output matrix
        A - first input distributed dense matrix in multiplication
        B - second input distributed dense matrix which is used in tranposed form
        C - the input/result distributed dense matrix

        Parameters:

        Declaration: ringCastRowBs(jj:x10.lang.Int,klen:x10.lang.Int,itCol:x10.lang.Int,dA:x10.matrix.dist.DistDenseMatrix,mapBsPs:x10.regionarray.DistArray[x10.regionarray.Array[x10.lang.Int]{self.rank==1}]{self.dist.region.rank==1},work1:x10.regionarray.DistArray[x10.matrix.DenseMatrix]{self.dist.region.rank==1}): void.
        Broadcast data within the row blocks, for all block rows in partitioning.
        

        Parameters:
        jj - the starting index of columns in block
        klen - number of column count
        itCol - the root's column block id
        dA - the data source from distributed dense matrix
        mapBsPs - mapping of block ids to place ids in the same row blocks
        work1 - the output data in distributed array

        This is SUMMA implementation in X10 for distributed dense matrix.


        In addition to the dimension requirement for matrix multiplication,
to use SUMMA, all input and output matrices must be decomposed
in the same way, which satisfies the matrix multiplication dimension requirement
for blocks in the same position of two input matrices and output matrix.


        To achieve better performance, panel size needs to be optimized, which could
be varied due to different matrices dimensions, network bandwidth, and
BLAS library performance.
